sections.heading: Personal Pronouns
sections.content:
Personal pronouns in Japanese are complex and context-dependent. Unlike English, Japanese has multiple words for "I," "you," etc., each with different formality levels, gender associations, and usage contexts. Additionally, pronouns are often omitted when clear from context.

私は学生です "I am a student" (formal/neutral) 僕は学生だ "I am a student" (casual male) 学生です "Am a student" (pronoun omitted)

children.heading: Formality and context matter
children.content: Multiple forms for each person Formality levels vary Gender associations exist Context determines choice Omission is common Not one-to-one with English

children.heading: Often omitted
children.content: With context: 学生です "(I) am a student" Full: 私は学生です "I am a student" Pronouns often unnecessary Japanese prefers omission

children.heading: 私 (watashi) - Standard neutral
children.content: 私は田中です "I am Tanaka" Most common Formal and neutral Used by everyone Safe choice

children.heading: 僕 (boku) - Casual male
children.content: 僕は学生だ "I am a student" Male speakers Casual to polite Not very casual

children.heading: 俺 (ore) - Very casual male
children.content: 俺は行く "I'm going" Male speakers only Very casual Friends, peers Rough/masculine

children.heading: あたし (atashi) - Feminine casual
children.content: あたし、嬉しい "I'm happy" Female speakers Casual, cute Young women

children.heading: 私たち (watashitachi) - We
children.content: 私たちは学生です "We are students" Standard "we" Formal and neutral

children.heading: 僕ら/俺ら (bokura/orera) - We (casual)
children.content: 僕らは行く "We're going" Casual "we" Male-oriented

children.heading: あなた (anata) - You
children.content: あなたは誰ですか "Who are you?" Formal situations Can be rude/distant Often avoided Used to strangers

children.heading: 君 (kimi) - You (casual)
children.content: 君は学生？ "Are you a student?" Casual, friendly Male speakers usually To equals/juniors

children.heading: お前 (omae) - You (rough)
children.content: お前、何してる？ "What are you doing?" Very casual/rough Male speakers Friends/subordinates Can be offensive

children.heading: あんた (anta) - You (casual/rough)
children.content: あんた誰？ "Who are you?" Casual to rough Can be confrontational Regional variations

children.heading: Avoidance strategies
children.content: Instead of "you": Use name: 田中さんは Use title: 先生は Use position: お客様は More polite More common

children.heading: 彼 (kare) - He
children.content: 彼は学生です "He is a student" Also means "boyfriend" Context dependent

children.heading: 彼女 (kanojo) - She
children.content: 彼女は先生です "She is a teacher" Also means "girlfriend" Context important

children.heading: あの人 (ano hito) - That person
children.content: あの人は誰ですか "Who is that person?" Neutral Polite Gender-neutral

children.heading: この人/その人 (kono hito/sono hito)
children.content: この人は友達です "This person is my friend" Demonstrative + person Depends on distance

children.heading: 彼ら/彼女ら (karera/kanojora) - They
children.content: 彼らは学生です "They are students" (male/mixed) 彼女らは学生です "They are students" (all female) Plural forms

children.heading: Adding たち/ら
children.content: 私たち "we" あなたたち "you (plural)" 彼ら "they" (male/mixed) 子供たち "children" たち: more formal ら: more casual

children.heading: Formal situations
children.content: 私 (watashi) あなた (use sparingly) 彼/彼女 私たち Business, strangers Official contexts

children.heading: Casual situations
children.content: 僕/俺 (male) あたし (female) 君/お前 僕ら/俺ら Friends, family Informal settings

children.heading: Clear from context
children.content: 学生です "(I) am a student" 行く？ "(Do you) go?" Topic established Understood subject

children.heading: Avoiding "you"
children.content: Instead: お名前は？ "Your name is...?" Not: あなたの名前は？ "Your name is...?" More polite without あなた

children.heading: Male-associated
children.content: 僕 (casual-polite) 俺 (very casual) 君 (to others) お前 (rough) Primarily male speakers

children.heading: Female-associated
children.content: あたし (casual) 私 (neutral, anyone) Women use 私 most あたし more feminine/young

children.heading: Neutral
children.content: 私 (anyone) あなた (formal) あの人 (that person) No gender restriction

children.heading: Overusing pronouns
children.content: Unnatural: 私は家に帰る。私は疲れた。⚠️ Natural: 家に帰る。疲れた。✓ "(I)'ll go home. (I)'m tired." Omit when clear

children.heading: Using あなた too much
children.content: Avoid: あなたは何が好き？⚠️ Better: 何が好き？✓ Or: 田中さんは何が好き？✓ "What do you like?" Use name instead

children.heading: Wrong formality level
children.content: To boss: 俺は行きます ⚠️ Correct: 私は行きます ✓ "I will go" Match situation

children.heading: Using own name (children/cute)
children.content: マリは嬉しい "Mari is happy" (saying "I'm happy") Children commonly Some women (cute speech) Self-reference

children.heading: Special pronouns
children.content: わし (older men, dialect) うち (Kansai: I) 自分 (jibun: various meanings) Regional variations Group-specific

children.heading: Workplace
children.content: 私 - standard 弊社 - our company (humble) 御社 - your company (respectful) 当社 - our company (neutral) Business formality

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 私は学生です "I am a student" 彼は先生です "He is a teacher" 私たちは日本人です "We are Japanese" あの人は誰ですか "Who is that person?"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 私は毎日日本語を勉強しています。 友達も一緒に勉強しています。 彼らはとても真面目です。 "I study Japanese every day. My friends also study together. They are very serious." 昨日、映画を見た。とても 面白かった。友達も気に入った みたいだ。 "(I) watched a movie yesterday. (It) was very interesting. (My) friend seemed to like it too." 田中さんは今日来ますか。 彼はいつも時間通りです。 "Will Tanaka come today? He is always on time."
